articles.description: South Africa host England in the first women’s one-day international at Diamond Oval, Kimberley – follow text updates and radio commentary.
articles.title: South Africa vs England LIVE: first women’s ODI – cricket score, radio commentary and text updates

articles.description: Manchester United abandoned plans to wear a jacket supporting the LGBTQ+ community before the Sunday's win over Everton because a player refused to wear it.
articles.title: Rainbow Laces: Manchester United scrap plans for LGBTQ+ jacket after player refuses to wear it

articles.description: Tiger Woods suggests that each American player in the Ryder Cup should receive $5m (£3.9m) and give that money to charity.
articles.title: Tiger Woods: US Ryder Cup players should get $5m and donate to charity

articles.description: Iga Swiatek, Jannik Sinner, Simona Halep and Tara Moore have had different experiences after testing positive for a banned substance - BBC Sport looks at why.
articles.title: Swiatek, Sinner, Halep & Moore - what are the differences and similarities in their doping cases?

articles.description: Steven Finn explains why fast bowling in Test cricket is different to county level and why England are looking beyond the numbers when making selections.
articles.title: Brydon Carse: Steven Finn on why England fast bowlers are performing better at international level than county cricket

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton will race for Mercedes for the final time on Sunday as driver and team part after "12 incredible years".
articles.title: Lewis Hamilton leaving Mercedes: 'A bittersweet ending, but the achievements remain indelible'

articles.description: The New York Knicks and Milwaukee Bucks earn their places in the NBA Cup quarter-finals with decisive wins.
articles.title: Knicks and Bucks advance to NBA Cup knockouts

articles.description: West Ham will decide Julen Lopetegui's short-term future by the weekend.
articles.title: Julen Lopetegui: West Ham to decide on manager's future by weekend

articles.description: Crystal Palace and defender Marc Guehi will face no formal action over the defender's messaging on his armband.
articles.title: Crystal Palace defender Marc Guehi avoids FA action over armband messaging

articles.description: Jofra Archer is "very interested" in playing Test cricket, according to captain Ben Stokes after the pace bowler extended his central contract with England.
articles.title: Jofra Archer signs new England contract and 'very interested' in playing Tests
